title: Cyclomics/CyclomicsSeq_consensus
description: Create consensus data for the Cyclomics CyclomicsSeq protocols, internal developer foccussed.

consensus_method.description: Consensus generation stategy, please fill the aditional settings.
consensus_method.help_text: Each strategy must have a submenu on the left.

read_folder.description: fastq_output folder containing either fastq or fastq.gz format, usually the fastq_pass folder made by MinKnow. Can contain barcode subfolders.

read_pattern.description: Search pattern for fastq files in the read_folder.

backbone.description: Backbone used in the CyclomicsSeq protocol.
backbone.help_text: ID of the backbone used in the lab, If set to custom please set the backbone_file option  under advanced user options to a fasta file with the sequence of the custom backbone as the only input where the name starts with `BB`.

primer_file.description: File of primers used for rotating to the start of the consensus read.
primer_file.help_text: Please note that the primers need to be shorter than the read for succesfull rotation to the start.

reference.description: Reference genome of the sequenced sample.
reference.help_text: reference genome of the sequenced material in fasta format. Will be used in several stages of the workflow, depending on consensus algorithm.

summarize_input.description: When enabled, Print a summary per sample ID for the input fastq files.
summarize_input.help_text: the Sample id is the name of the folder in which the fastq is located.

summarize_output.description: When enabled, Print a summary per sample ID for the output fastq files.
summarize_output.help_text: the Sample id is the name of the folder in which the fastq is located.

backbone_file.description: Path for a custom backbone, dont forget to set backbone to custom
backbone_file.help_text: Usefull for testing backbone designs witout the need for a pipeline update.

skip_alignment.description: When enabled skip the last alignment step per ID.
skip_alignment.help_text: the Sample id is the name of the folder in which the fastq is located.
